Class SimpleWebListener

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WebListener
    public class SimpleWebListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements WebListener
    Custom HTTP implementation. It's not overengineering, it's a fucking waste of time.

      • tryAndParse

        public void tryAndParse​(simplenet.Client client,
                        java.util.function.BiFunction<java.lang.String[],​java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String>,​java.lang.Boolean> requestHeaderFunction)
        Description copied from interface: WebListener
        Invokes WebListener.parseHeaders(Client, BiConsumer) and if the requestHeaderFunction returns false, an error response is sent. Either way, the Client given is closed at the end.
        Specified by:
        tryAndParse in interface WebListener
        Parameters:
        client - The Client
        requestHeaderFunction - The function giving request data and header data, returning if the request was successful.

      • createHeaders

        public java.lang.String createHeaders()
        Description copied from interface: WebListener
        Creates default headers for WebListener.generateRequest(String). By default, this is: 
             HTTP/1.1 200 OK
     Server: EmojIDE
     Content-Length: [dynamic]
     Content-Type: text/html
     Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *
     Connection: Closed
        Specified by:
        createHeaders in interface WebListener
        Returns:
        The headers
